channel.title: Psalms on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in Psalms on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: Psalms 1
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 1

1People are blessed that don’t take advice from the wicked or stand among sinners or sit with scoffers,

2but delight in the Law of the LORD and meditate on it day and night.

3They’re like trees planted beside a river that bear fruit in season, whose leaves don’t wither. They’re successful at what they do.

4Sinners aren’t like that: they’re like chaff that wind blows away;

5they won’t withstand judgment or stand among the godly.

item.title: Psalms 2
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 2

1Why do the nations get together to plot pointless schemes?

2Kings take their stand and rulers hold counsel against the LORD and his Anointed One [Messiah]: 3“Let’s break their bonds and throw them away.”

4The One that’s in heaven laughs; the LORD scoffs at them.

5He’ll speak to them in his anger and terrify them with his fury: 6“I’ve installed my King on Zion, my holy mountain.”

item.title: Psalms 3
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 3

1LORD, I have so many enemies; so many are working against me;

2so many are saying, “God’s not going to help him.”

Ps 3:1-2

3But you’re my shield, LORD, my glory, the One that holds my head up.

4When I call out to you, you answer from your holy mountain.

5I lie down to sleep and wake up again because you sustain me.

6I won’t be afraid

item.title: Psalms 4
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 4

1Righteous God, answer when I call! Take time for me in my distress; listen graciously to my prayer.

2People, how long will you try to ruin my reputation? How long will you love unfounded accusations and outright lies?

3Just remember that the LORD sets good people apart for himself; he’ll listen when I call out to him.

Ps 4:1-3

4If you’re angry, don’t sin; just think it to yourself in bed; don’t act it out.

item.title: Psalms 5
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 5

1Listen to me, LORD; Pay attention to my groaning.

2Hear my call for help, my God and King, because I pray only to you.

3You hear me in the mornings, when I offer my prayers and wait.

4You’re not amused by sinfulness because there’s nothing bad about you.

5Braggards can’t stand in your presence because you send away everyone that sins.

6You destroy liars and abhor bloodthirsty people.

item.title: Psalms 6
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 6

1Don’t lash out at me, LORD, or take me to task in your anger.

2Be gracious to me because I’m weak; heal me because I’m troubled deep inside.

3I’m really scared; how long, LORD, before you save me?

4Come back and rescue me; because of your enduring love, save me;

5because nobody talks about you when they’re dead; who gives you gratitude in Sheol?

Ps 6:1-5

item.title: Psalms 7
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 7

2so they won’t tear me apart like a lion does and drag me away with no one to rescue me. 3 LORD my God, if I’ve done wrong, if there’s any injustice in me,

4if I’ve betrayed a friend or plundered an adversary for no reason,

5chase me down and slay me; trample me on the ground; lay my honor in the dust.

Ps 7:1-5

6Rise up in anger, LORD, against my angry enemies; wake up and decree justice on my behalf.

item.title: Psalms 8
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 8

1LORD, our Lord, you’re so majestic all over the world! You display your splendor higher than the sky!

2Out of the mouth of infants and nursing babies you’ve established a defensive wall against your adversaries, to silence enemies that want revenge.

Ps 8:1-2

3When I look at the sky, the work of your fingers, the moon and stars you’ve set in place,

4what are we that you give us any thought or care about us?

item.title: Psalms 9
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 9

1I’ll thank you, LORD, with all my heart and call attention to the amazing things you’ve done.

2I’ll gladly celebrate over you and sing your praise, Most High.

3When my enemies retreated, they staggered and died in front of you

4because you judged in my favor; you sat on your throne and judged justly.

5You’ve rebuked the nations, destroyed the wicked, and blotted out their names forever.

item.title: Psalms 10
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 10

1Why stand so far away, LORD? Why hide when trouble comes?

2Sinners hunt down the poor in arrogance and get themselves caught in their own schemes.

3They brag about their sinful desires; they bless the greedy and curse the LORD.

4In their arrogance, they don’t trust in him; they just keep acting like there’s no God.

Ps 10:1-4

5Yet they always seem to prosper; they don’t see your coming judgments from on high; they sneer at adversaries

item.title: Psalms 11
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 11

1I rely on the LORD’s protection; so why tell me, “Flee like a bird to the mountains

2because the ungodly are bending the bow; they’re putting their arrow to the string to shoot from the shadows at the godly in heart.

3If the foundations of society collapse, what can good people do?”

4The LORD is in his holy Temple; he rules from heaven, watching everyone, examining each one.

item.title: Psalms 12
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 12

1Help, LORD; there aren’t any decent people left; the faithful are disappearing.

2Neighbors lie to one another and speak with flattering lips and deceitful hearts.

3May the LORD cut off their flattering lips and bragging tongues 4that say “We can talk our way out of anything; they’re our lips; who’s going to stop us?”

5The LORD says, “Since the oppressed are suffering violence and the needy groan, I’ll come to give them the protection they long for.”

item.title: Psalms 13
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 13

1Fools keep telling themselves there’s no God, corrupt people that do corrupt things; none of them does what’s right.

2The LORD looks down from heaven to see if there’s anybody that lives wisely, if anybody seeks him.

3But they’ve all veered off course and become corrupted; not a one of them does what’s right, not a one.

4Don’t sinners realize what they’re doing when they eat up my people like bread and refuse to call on me?

item.title: Psalms 15
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 15

1LORD, who can live in your Tabernacle? Who can reside on your holy hill?

2Those who act with integrity, who do what’s right and tell the truth;

3who don’t mistreat their neighbors or join in gossiping about their friends;

4who despise reprobates, but honor people that respect the LORD, who even swear to their own disadvantage and carry it through,

5that don’t charge interest or accept bribes against innocent people. People like that will always be secure.

item.title: Psalms 16
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 16

1Protect me, LORD; you’re my refuge.

2I say, “You’re my Lord; apart from you, I don’t have anything good.”

3The godly people on earth are the noble ones I delight in.

4Trouble multiplies for those who rush off to some other god; I won’t pour out blood offerings with them or even say their names.

5The LORD is my permanent possession, my cup; he holds in safekeeping what’s allotted to me.

item.title: Psalms 17
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 17

1LORD; listen to my call for justice; pay attention to my sincere prayer.

2Declare me innocent because you see that I’m righteous.

3You’ve visited me at night and tested my heart; you’ve put me on trial and found nothing wrong; I’m determined not to say anything sinful.

4Your word has kept me from following the example of cruel people.

5My steps have stayed on your path; my feet haven’t slipped.

item.title: Psalms 18
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 18

2my fortress, my deliverer, my God, my Rock, my Refuge; my shield, the place that saves me, my stronghold.”

3I called on him who deserves praise, and he saved me from my enemies.

4The waves of death entangled me; the torrents of destruction flooded over me;

5the cords of Sheol tied me down; the snares of death had entrapped me.

6In my desperation, I cried out to the LORD, and he heard me in his Temple.

item.title: Psalms 19
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 19

1The heavens show God’s glory; the sky displays his workmanship.

2Day in and day out they speak; night after night they display intelligence.

3There’s no speech or words; there’s nothing to hear.

4Their testimony goes out to the whole world, their message to the ends of the earth; in them he’s pitched a tent for the sun.

5It’s like a groom coming out of his room, excited like a man in shape to run a race.

item.title: Psalms 20
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 20

1When trouble comes, may the LORD answer you! May Jacob’s God set you safely on high!

2May he send help from the sanctuary and support you from Zion!

3May he remember your many meal offerings and find your burnt offerings acceptable.

4May he grant you your heart’s desire and make your plans successful.

5You’ll sing for joy over his deliverance and hoist your banners in his name. May the LORD give you your petitions.

item.title: Psalms 21
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 21

1LORD, the king delights in your strength; he’s happy because you’ve helped him.

2You’ve given him his heart’s desire; you didn’t withhold his request.

3You met him with blessings and crowned him with fine gold.

4He asked you for life, and you gave him life everlasting.

5He has great honor because you delivered him and endowed him with splendor and majesty.

6You make him blessed forever and happy because you’re with him.

item.title: Psalms 22
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 22

1My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from helping me, so far from my groaning?

2I call out in the daytime, but you don’t answer; I don’t get any relief at night.

3Yet you’re holy, enthroned on Israel’s praises.

4Our ancestors trusted in you, and you delivered them.

5They called out to you, and you saved them; they relied on you, and you didn’t disappoint them.

item.title: Psalms 23
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 23

1The LORD is my shepherd; I’ll have everything I need.

2He beds me down in green pasture and leads me beside still water.

3He refreshes me and guides me along good paths for his honor.

4Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I won’t be afraid, because he’s with me; his rod and staff reassure me.

5You set a table for me in front of my enemies; you anoint my head with oil; my cup runs over.

item.title: Psalms 24
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 24

1The earth and everything in it belongs to the LORD, the world and those who live here.

2He positioned land higher than seas, more elevated than ocean currents.

3Who can climb his mountain and stand in his holy place?

4People with clean hands and pure hearts, who don’t offer themselves up to idols or lie under oath.

5They’ll receive a blessing from the LORD, goodness from the God who keeps them safe.

item.title: Psalms 25
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 25

1I hold my life up to you, LORD;

2I trust you; don’t let me down or let my enemies celebrate over my defeat.

3Nobody that waits for you will be discredited; people who deal treacherously are the ones that will be discredited.

Ps 25:1-3

4LORD, let me know your ways; teach me your paths;

5lead me in your truth because you keep me safe; I’ll always depend on you.

item.title: Psalms 26
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 26

1Declare me innocent, LORD, because I’ve conducted myself with integrity and trusted in you without wavering.

2Examine me, put me on trial, test my motives and attitude.

3I keep my eye on your unfailing love and follow you faithfully.

4I don’t sit with deceitful people or run around with pretenders.

5I detest the company of unreliable people and refuse to join in with sinners.

item.title: Psalms 27
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 27

1The LORD is my light and salvation; who am I going to be afraid of? He defends me; who am I going to dread?

2When bad people come to devour me, they stumble and fall.

3Though an army attacks me, it won’t frighten me; though war breaks out against me, I’ll stay confident.

Ps 27:1-3

4I ask the LORD for one thing—what I look for most: to live in his house my whole life, to see his beauty and meditate in his Temple.

item.title: Psalms 28
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 28

1I’m calling out to you, LORD; don’t turn a deaf ear, my Rock; otherwise, I’ll be like someone going down to the Pit.

2Help me when I plead for help, when I lift up my hands toward your holy sanctuary.

3Don’t drag me away with the wicked, with those who sin, who offer their neighbors peace while selfish motives lurk in their hearts.

4Pay them back according to their deeds, in proportion to the sin they practice.

item.title: Psalms 29
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 29

1Children of the mighty, attribute to the LORD honor and strength.

2Honor him like he deserves; worship him in his holy splendor.

Ps 29:1-2

3The sound from the LORD carries out over the water; our glorious God thunders across the ocean expanse.

4His voice is loud and majestic

5and blows down cedars in Lebanon.

6He makes Lebanon skip like a calf and Sirion [Mt. Hermon] jump around like a young wild ox.

item.title: Psalms 30
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 30

1I’ll praise you, LORD, because you’ve rescued me; you haven’t let my enemies celebrate victory over me.

2I appealed to you for help, my God, and you restored my health;

3you brought me up from Sheol; you kept me from going down to the Pit.

4Sing praise to the LORD, his holy people; thank him, 5because his anger is only for a little while, but his blessing lasts a lifetime. Weeping may go on all night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.

item.title: Psalms 31
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 31

1I take refuge in you, LORD; never let me be disgraced; in your goodness protect me.

2Listen to me, rescue me quickly; be a rock for me, a strong fortress to save me.

3You’re my rock and fortress; for your honor, lead me and guide me.

4Free me out of the trap people secretly laid for me because you’re my protection.

5I’m entrusting my spirit to you; rescue me, LORD, true God.

item.title: Psalms 32
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 32

1How blessed they are whose sin God forgives, whose transgression he covers;

2whose disobedience the LORD doesn’t hold against them, whose spirit doesn’t harbor deceit!

3When I didn’t acknowledge my sin, my body wasted away, I moaned all day,

4your hand weighed on me day and night, my strength drained away in the summer heat.

5When I acknowledged it and said, “I’ll confess my sin to the LORD,” you forgave me.

item.title: Psalms 33
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 33

1Sing for joy to the LORD, good people; praise is fitting for the godly.

2Give him thanks with a lyre; sing praises to him with a ten-string harp.

3Sing a new song to him; play skillfully and shout for joy.

4You can believe what he says and rely on what he does.

5He loves goodness and justice, and fills the world with his enduring love.

Ps 33:1-5

6The LORD made the sky with a word, all its host with the breath from his mouth.

item.title: Psalms 34
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 34

1I’ll bless the LORD at all times and praise him constantly.

2I’ll make my boast about him; the helpless will hear it and take heart.

3Let’s tell how great the LORD is; let’s honor him together.

4I looked to the LORD; he answered me and freed me from my fears.

5People that look to him are radiant; they never look subdued.

6I cried out in my suffering, and he listened and saved me from my troubles.

item.title: Psalms 35
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 35

1LORD, oppose the ones that oppose me; fight those who fight me.

2Put on buckler and shield, and come to my aid.

3Draw spear and javelin against my pursuers; tell me you’ll save me.

4Dishonor the ones that want to kill me; drive back and humiliate those who scheme against me.

5Make them like chaff in the wind, with the angel of the LORD blowing them.

item.title: Psalms 36
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 36

1Sin speaks to sinful people’s hearts; they don’t respect God at all.

2They flatter themselves that he can’t discover their sin.

3Their words deceive; they’ve stopped being wise and doing good.

4They devise schemes in bed and carry them out in the morning with no qualms

Ps 36:1-4

5LORD, your enduring love reaches the stars; your faithfulness is as high as the sky;

6your goodness as mighty as the mountains; your justice as deep as the ocean; your provision sufficient for everything that breathes.

item.title: Psalms 37
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 37

1Don’t worry about bad people or envy those who do wrong;

2they’ll wither like grass and fade like flowers.

3Trust in the LORD and do good so you can live in the land and enjoy security.

4Delight in the LORD, and he’ll give you what your heart desires.

5Commit your way to him and trust him, and he’ll act on your behalf.

6He’ll bring forth your goodness like the dawn and your vindication like the midday sun.

item.title: Psalms 38
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 38

1LORD, don’t rebuke me in your wrath or discipline me in your furious anger.

2Your arrows have pierced deep into me; your hand has come down hard on me.

3Because of your indignation, my body’s not sound; by my sin I’ve ruined my health.

4My iniquities have piled up higher than my head and weighed me down.

5My wounds have festered and grown foul. My foolish choices 6have doubled me over; I grieve all the time;

item.title: Psalms 39
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 39

1I said, “I’ll watch what I do so I won’t sin with my tongue; I’ll put a muzzle on my mouth when sinful people come around.”

2But when I kept silent even about what was good, it was of no avail; my agitation grew worse.

3The more I thought about it the more the fire burned within me; so I spoke up: 4“LORD, show me my end, how long I’ll live; let me realize how fleeting my life is.

item.title: Psalms 40
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 40

1I waited patiently for the LORD; he listened to my call for help.

2He brought me up out of the pit of despair, out of the muddy clay, set my feet on solid rock, and made my footsteps secure.

3He put a new song in me, a song about praising God; other people will hear it, see what he’s done, and trust in him.

4How blessed people are that trust in the LORD instead of turning to proud or deceitful people.

item.title: Psalms 41
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 41

1How blessed people are that have regard for the poor; the LORD will deliver them when they have need.

2He’ll protect them, keep them alive, and call them blessed;

3sustain them when they’re sick and restore them to health.

Ps 41:1-3

4I said, “Be gracious to me, LORD; heal my soul because I’ve sinned against you.”

5My enemies say rude things about me: “When’s he going to die so we can forget about him?”

item.title: Psalms 42
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 42

1My soul pants for God like a deer pants for water.

2My soul is thirsty for the living God; when will I ever see him?

3My tears have been my food day and night as people ask me all the time, “Where’s your God?”

4I think about these things as I pour out my soul. I used to go with the throng, leading the procession to the house of God, singing for joy and giving thanks in the great celebration.

item.title: Psalms 43
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 43

1Declare me innocent, God; defend me against this ungodly nation; deliver me from liars!

2You’re the God that I rely on for courage; why reject me? Why do I go around in mourning because my enemies oppress me?

3Send your light and truth to lead me, to bring me to the holy hill where you live.

4Then I can go to your altar, my greatest source of joy, and praise you with a harp.

item.title: Psalms 44
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 44

1God, our ancestors have told us what you did in their time long ago.

2You drove out nations and planted this one; you struck them and scattered them abroad.

3Our ancestors didn’t conquer the land with their sword; their own arm didn’t save them. Your right hand, your arm, the light of your presence did it when you showed them favor.

Ps 44:1-3

4You’re my King, God; ordain victories for Jacob in our day too.

item.title: Psalms 45
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 45

1My heart is overflowing with a noble theme as I recite my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a gifted poet.

2You’re more handsome than the sons of men; gracious words stream from on your lips; God has blessed you forever.

3Strap your sword to your thigh, Mighty Warrior, in your splendor and majesty! 4 In your majesty, ride on to victory, defending truth, humility, and goodness; have your right hand display awesome deeds.

item.title: Psalms 46
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 46

1God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help when trouble comes.

2So we won’t be afraid though the ground tremors, though the mountains cascade into the sea,

3though its water roars and foams, though the ground quakes at its tsunamis.

4There’s a river of joy that flows into the city of God, the sacred place where the Most High lives.

5God is there; it’s unmovable; from the break of day, he protects it.

item.title: Psalms 47
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 47

1Clap your hands, everybody; shout to God with joy;

2because you are to revere the LORD Most High, the great King over the whole world.

3He subdued people groups under us, put nations beneath our feet,

4and chose our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob that he loves.

Ps 47:1-4

5God has ascended with a shout, with a trumpet fanfare.

6Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises;

item.title: Psalms 48
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 48

1The LORD is great and deserves great praise in the city of our God on his holy mountain.

2Mount Zion, the heights of Zaphon, is high and beautiful— the joy of the whole earth, the city of the great King.

3In its towers God reveals himself as a strong defense.

4Kings joined forces and advanced against that strong defense.

5But as soon as it came into view, they panicked and fled.

item.title: Psalms 49
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 49

1Hear this, every nation; listen, everyone on earth,

2low and high, rich and poor alike.

3My words are wise; my thoughts are full of insight.

4I listen to proverbs and expound my riddles on a harp.

5Why should I be afraid when there’s adversity, when my enemies’ sins are all around me,

6people who trust in their wealth and brag about how rich they are?

7Nobody can use wealth to redeem a brother from death or pay God a ransom for him—

item.title: Psalms 50
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 50

1God, the Mighty One, the LORD, has spoken and calls to earth from sunrise to sunset.

2He shines forth out of Zion in perfect beauty.

3Our God comes; he doesn’t stay quiet; a fire consumes in front of him; a storm rages around him.

4He calls on the sky above and the earth beneath to witness the judgment of his people. 5“Gather my people to me that I’ve made a covenant with by sacrifice.”

item.title: Psalms 51
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 51

1Be gracious to me, God, in proportion to your enduring love; according to your great mercy, blot out my transgressions.

2Wash me thoroughly from my sin; cleanse me from my iniquity.

3I know my failings; my sin always weighs on my mind.

4I’ve sinned against you and you only; I did what you consider evil; so you’re justified in what you say to me, blameless when you condemn me.

item.title: Psalms 52
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 52

1God’s enduring love lasts all day; so why brag about sinning, great soldier?

2Your tongue cuts like a razor.

3You like evil more than good, falsehood more than truth.

4You like words that devour and a lying tongue that deceives.

5But God will strike you down once and for all; he’ll pull you out of your tent and uproot you from the land of the living.

item.title: Psalms 53
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 53

1Fools tell themselves there’s no God. They’re corrupt and commit disgusting sins; none of them does what’s good.

2God looks down from heaven to see if anybody understands, if anybody looks to him.

3Every one of them has turned aside and become corrupt; not a one does what’s good, not a one.

Ps 53:1-3

4Won’t sinners ever learn? They eat up my people like bread and don’t pray to me.

item.title: Psalms 54
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 54

1Deliver me, God, by your name; vindicate me by your power.

2Listen to my prayer; hear what I have to say.

3Foreigners have attacked me; violent people have tried to kill me; they don’t care about you.

4But God helps me; the LORD sustains my life.

5He pays back my adversaries and destroys them in his faithfulness.

6I’ll sacrifice to him willingly and thank him because he’s good.

item.title: Psalms 55
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 55

1Hear my prayer, God; don’t ignore my plea.

2Listen and answer; trouble has overwhelmed me; I’m distracted

3by the threats of my enemies, by bringing suffering on me and bearing angry grudges against me.

Ps 55:1-3

4My heart’s pounding; terror of death has fallen on me.

5Fear and trembling have come over me; horror has overwhelmed me.

6I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove! I’d fly off and find peace.

item.title: Psalms 56
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 56

1Be gracious, God; people are walking all over me, oppressing me all the time, 2attacking me.

3When I’m afraid, I put my trust in you.

4In you, whose word I praise, I’ve put my trust; what can mortals do to me?

5All day long they try to frustrate my purposes; they think up ways to harm me.

6They stir up conflict, they lurk, they watch my every step, looking for a chance to kill me.

item.title: Psalms 57
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 57

1Be gracious to me, God, because I depend on you to protect me; in the shadow of your wings I take refuge till danger passes.

2I call out to God Most High, who accomplishes everything for me;

3he sends help from heaven to rescue me and discredits whoever tries to run over me.

Ps 57:1-3

4I live among lions; I have to lie among those who breathe fire, people whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.

item.title: Psalms 58
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 58

1Leaders, do you decree what’s right? Do you judge justly?

2No, you plot injustice in your hearts and spread violence in the land.

3The sinful go astray from the womb; they lie from the time they’re born.

4They have venom like vipers, and stop up their ears like deaf cobras

5so they don’t hear their charmers’ voices or those skilled at casting spells.

Ps 58:1-5

6Pull out their fangs, God; break the teeth out of the young lions.

item.title: Psalms 59
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 59

1Deliver me from my enemies, God; set me on high away from my attackers.

2Save me from sinners; rescue me from bloodthirsty people.

3They lie in ambush to kill me; fierce enemies stir up conflict against me, LORD, but not for my transgression.

4For no fault of mine, they run to attack me; get up to see and help me!

Ps 59:1-4

5LORD God of Hosts, God of Israel, wake up and punish the nations; don’t extend grace to any that are treacherous.

item.title: Psalms 60
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 60

1You’ve rejected us, God, and broken us; you’ve been angry, but restore us now.

2You’ve made the land quake; you’ve split it open; now repair the faults and stop the tremors.

3You’ve made your people endure hardship and given us wine that makes us stagger.

4You’ve raised a banner for those who respect you as a rallying point for truth.

5Save us now with your right hand and answer us, deliver your beloved.

item.title: Psalms 61
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 61

1Listen to my prayer, God; hear my prayer.

2With a faint heart I call to you from the end of the earth; lead me to the rock that’s higher than me.

3You’re my refuge, my strong tower against the enemy.

4Let me live in your tent forever and take shelter under your wings.

5You’ve heard my vows, God, and given me the inheritance that comes to those who respect you.

item.title: Psalms 62
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 62

1I wait for God alone because my victory comes from him.

2He alone is my rock, my salvation, my fortress; I won’t be shaken.

3How long will youpl assail me so you can murder me, like a leaning wall or crumbling fence?

4Your only intention is to knock me down; you enjoy lying about me; you bless out loud but curse inside.

Ps 62:1-4

5My soul, wait in silence for God because my hope lies only in him.

item.title: Psalms 63
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 63

1God, you’re my God; I look to you in earnest; my soul thirsts for you; my flesh yearns for you in this dry, weary land.

2So I’ve looked at you in the sanctuary and seen your power and glory. 3 I’ll praise you because your enduring love is better than life;

4I’ll bless you as long as I live and lift up my hands in your name.

item.title: Psalms 64
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 64

1Listen to my complaint, God; keep me from living in dread of my enemies.

2Hide me from the secret plots of bad people, from the schemes of sinners

3that sharpen their tongue like a sword, that aim bitter words like arrows,

4that shoot at innocent people from hiding places, and do it suddenly without qualms.

5They latch onto sinful purposes and talk secretly about setting traps; they say, “Who will notice?”

item.title: Psalms 65
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 65

5You answer us with awesome deeds, God who keeps us safe, who is trusted in every land and the farthest sea.

6You established the mountains by your power and dressed yourself with strength,

7you that still the roaring seas and the disturbances among the nations.

8They who live at the ends of the earth stand in awe at your wonders; you make the dawn and sunset shout for joy.

item.title: Psalms 66
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 66

1Make a joyful sound to God, all the earth.

2Sing about his honor; make his praise glorious.

3Say to him, “What you do is so awesome! Your enemies feign obedience to you out of fear for your power.

4All the earth worships you and praises you; they sing praises to you.”

Ps 66:1-4

5Come and see what God has done; it’s awesome what he’s done for people.

item.title: Psalms 67
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 67

1God, be gracious and bless us; smile at us

2so every nation can know your way and your saving power.

3May the nations praise you; may they all praise you.

4May they be happy and sing because you judge them justly and guide them.

5May the nations praise you, God; may they all praise you.

6The earth has yielded its produce; God, our God, has blessed us

item.title: Psalms 68
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 68

1Arise, God, scatter your enemies; chase off those who hate you!

2Blow them away like smoke; melt them like wax near fire; make sinners perish in your presence.

3But may good people be happy, delight in your presence, celebrate and be glad.

4So sing to God, sing praises to him; lay out a highway for the One that rides through deserts, whose name is Yah, and celebrate with him.

item.title: Psalms 69
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 69

1Save me, God; I’m in water up to my neck!

2I’ve sunk in deep mud, where there’s no foothold; a flood is sweeping over me.

3I’m worn out from crying; my throat’s dry; my eyes are red from crying, waiting for my God.

4The people that hate me for no reason outnumber the hairs on my head; those who want to destroy me are powerful; they’re trying to make me repay what I didn’t steal.

item.title: Psalms 70
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 70

1Hurry and deliver me, LORD; come quick to help me.

2Discredit those who want to kill me; turn them back and dishonor the people that delight in harming me.

3Because of their disgrace, turn them back those who say, “Aha, Aha.”

4May the ones that depend on you be happy in you; may those who love your deliverance repeatedly say, “God is great.”

5But I’m poor and needy, LORD! you’re my deliverer; don’t delay.

item.title: Psalms 71
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 71

1I’ve taken refuge in you, LORD; don’t let me be discredited.

2In your goodness, rescue me; listen to me and save me.

3Be my rock of refuge that I can always go to; give orders to save me because you’re my rock and fortress.

4Rescue me from sinners, from the grasp of cruel men.

5You’re my hope, Lord GOD, my confidence since I was young.

6the One that took me from my mother’s womb and sustained me since I was born.

item.title: Psalms 72
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 72

1Give the king your judgments, God; give your goodness to his son.

2May he judge your people fairly, your oppressed ones with justice.

3Let the mountains bring prosperity to the people; may the hills bring goodness.

4May he defend the downtrodden, save the children of the needy, and crush their oppressors.

Ps 72:1-4

5Let them respect you as long as the sun lasts, as long as the moon endures—throughout all generations.

item.title: Psalms 73
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 73

1God is good to Israel, to those whose hearts are pure.

2I’d almost stumbled; my steps almost slipped;

3because I envied the prosperity of the arrogant.

4They don’t seem to suffer when they die; their bodies are healthy and well.

5They don’t have trouble like other people; they aren’t stricken like everyone else.

6So pride is the gold chain around their neck; violence is their clothes.

item.title: Psalms 74
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 74

1Why have you thrown us away forever, God? Why does your anger smoke at the sheep in your pasture?

2Remember your community that you bought so long ago, that you redeemed as a tribe for your heritage, Mount Zion, where you’ve lived.

3Direct your attention to its continuing ruins; the enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary.

4Your adversaries have roared in your sanctuary and set up their own standards for signs.

item.title: Psalms 75
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 75

1Thank you, God, for being close by; people declare your wonderful deeds. 2“When I set a time for judgment; I’ll judge even-handedly.

3The earth and everybody in it melt; I’m the One that firmly set its pillars.

4I said to people that brag, ‘Stop it,’ and to sinners, ‘Don’t lift up your horns;

5don’t raise them up high or talk with such arrogance.’”

Ps 75:1-5

6Exaltation doesn’t come from the east or west,

item.title: Psalms 76
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 76

1God is known in Judah; his name is great in Israel.

2His home is in Salem; he lives on Zion.

3He has broken flaming arrows there, shields, swords, and weapons of war.

4You’re glorious, more majestic than mountains full of beasts of prey.

5Our stouthearted enemies have been stripped of their spoil; they’ve sunk into deep sleep; none of the soldiers could raise a hand against us.

item.title: Psalms 77
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 77

1I raise my voice up to God; I call out loud; it rises to him so he’ll hear me.

2When trouble comes, I turn to the LORD for help. All night I reach out to him, but I get no reassurance.

3When I think about him, I’m shaken; I sigh and feel faint.

4He won’t let me sleep; I’m in such distress I can’t pray.

5I think about days gone by, years ago.

item.title: Psalms 78
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 78

1Listen to my instruction, my people; pay attention to what I’m saying.

2I’ll tell a parable and offer hidden truths from our history,

3things we’ve heard and known from our ancestors.

4We won’t keep them from our children; we’ll tell the next generation what we praise the LORD for: his strength, the amazing things he’s done.

Ps 78:1-4

5He established a Testimony in Jacob and appointed a Law in Israel, one that he commanded our ancestors to teach their children;

item.title: Psalms 79
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 79

1Other nations have invaded your inheritance, God; they’ve defiled your holy Temple and laid Jerusalem in ruins.

2They’ve given the buzzards your servants’ corpses, and the wild animals the flesh of your holy people.

3They’ve poured out their blood like water around Jerusalem; there wasn’t anybody to bury them.

4We’ve become a disgrace to our neighbors, mocked and derided by the people around us.

5LORD, will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy keep burning like fire?

item.title: Psalms 80
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 80

1Listen, Shepherd of Israel, you that lead Joseph like a flock; show your glory, you that are enthroned above the cherubs.

2Stir up your power against Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh; and come to rescue us.

3Restore us, God; look at us with favor so we’ll be saved.

Ps 80:1-3

4LORD God of Hosts, how long will you be angry with our prayers?

5You’ve fed us tears and made us drink them in full measure.

item.title: Psalms 81
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 81

1Sing to God your Strength; make a joyful sound to Jacob’s God.

2Sing, beat the tambourine, pluck the lyre and harp.

3At the new moons blow your ram’s horn, at the full moon and on your festival days.

4It’s a statute for Israel, an ordinance from Jacob’s God.

5He established it as a Testimony in Joseph when he displayed his power all over Egypt. I heard a language I didn’t know, saying.

item.title: Psalms 82
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 82

1God presides over the divine council and judges you judges.

2So how long will youpl judge unjustly by showingpl partiality to lawbreakers?

3Renderpl justice to the weak and fatherless; standpl up for the oppressed and destitute.

4Rescuepl the weak and needy; deliverpl them from bad people.

Ps 82:1-4

5You don’t know or understand; You’re walking around in the dark; the very foundations of your world are unstable.

item.title: Psalms 83
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 83

1God, don’t keep quiet; don’t be silent.

2Your enemies are making an uproar; those who hate you are exalting themselves.

3They’re plotting against your people, conspiring against them 4and saying, “Let’s wipe out their nation so no one will remember them anymore.”

5Together they’re signing a treaty against you:

6Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites;

7Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia and the people in Tyre;

item.title: Psalms 84
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 84

1Your Temple is so beautiful, LORD of Hosts!

2I long, yes, even faint with longing for your courts; my body and soul sing for joy to the living God.

3Even a sparrow finds a home for herself, a swallow builds a nest to raise her young near your altars, LORD of Hosts, my God and King.

4How blessed they are who live in your Temple and continually sing your praises.

item.title: Psalms 85
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 85

1LORD, you blessed your land; you restored the fortunes of Jacob;

2you forgave your people’s iniquity and pardoned their sins;

3you withdrew your fury and turned away from your hot anger.

4Restore us, our Deliverer; end your displeasure with us.

5Will you be angry with us forever? Will you extend your wrath to every generation?

6Won’t you revive us so we can celebrate over you?

7Show us your enduring love, LORD; grant us your salvation.

item.title: Psalms 86
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 86

1Listen, LORD, and answer me because I’m troubled and in need.

2Preserve my life because I’m a godly man; save me because I trust in you.

3Be gracious to me because I call out to you all the time.

4Make me happy because I hold up my life to you.

5You’re good, ready to forgive, and abundant in enduring love to everyone that calls on you.

6Hear my prayer, LORD; listen to my petition.

item.title: Psalms 87
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 87

1The city that the LORD founded stands on his holy mountain;

2he loves Zion more than the other places in Jacob.

3Glorious things are said about you, city of God. 4“I’ll count Rahab [Egypt] and Babylon among those who know me, Philistia, Tyre, and Nubia too: ‘They’ve become citizens there,’” people will say.

5But they will say about Zion, “This one and that one were born here”; the Most High himself has made it so.

item.title: Psalms 88
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 88

1LORD God who keeps me safe, I call out to you day and night.

2Let my prayer come to you; listen to my call!

3I’ve had so much trouble; I’m close to Sheol.

4I’m as good as dead, like someone with no strength left.

5Abandoned among the dead like someone slain in the grave, I’m forgotten and cut off from you.

6You’ve put me in the Pit, in regions dark and deep.

item.title: Psalms 89
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 89

1I’ll sing forever about the LORD’s enduring love and make known his faithfulness to every generation,

2because I’ve said, “You build up enduring love; in the heavens you establish your faithfulness.”

3The LORD said, “I’ve made a covenant with my chosen one; I’ve sworn to David my servant, 4‘I’ll make your descendants secure forever and build up your throne to all generations.’”

Ps 89:1-4

item.title: Psalms 90
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 90

1LORD, through all generations you’ve been our dwelling place.

2Before the mountains were born or you gave birth to the world, from one end of time to the other, you’ve been God.

Ps 90:1-2

3You turn people back to dust and say, “Return to dust, mortals.”

4A thousand years to you are like yesterday, like a watch in the night.

5You sweep us away like the dreams in our sleep. In the morning we sprout like grass 6and flourish; then toward evening we fade like blossoms and wither away.

item.title: Psalms 91
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 91

1Those who live in the shelter of the Most High will find rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

2They’ll say about the LORD, “Our refuge and fortress, the God we trust!”

Ps 91:1-2

3He delivers you from the trapper’s snare and deadly pestilence.

4He covers you with his pinions; you can find refuge under his wings; his faithfulness shields and protects you.

5You won’t be afraid of terrors at night, of arrows that fly by day,

item.title: Psalms 92
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 92

1It’s good to thank you, LORD, to sing praises to you, Most High;

2to declare your enduring love in the morning and your faithfulness at night

3with a lute and a ten-stringed harp, with melody on a lyre.

4Because you’ve made me happy by what you’ve done, I’ll sing for joy over what you do.

Ps 92:1-4

5Your deeds are so great, LORD, your thoughts so deep!

item.title: Psalms 93
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 93

1The LORD reigns, robed in majesty, dressed in strength. The world stands firm; it won’t move.

2Your throne has been secure from of old; you’re from eternity past.

3The floods have swelled; the roar of their pounding waves has increased.

4But more than the thunder of overwhelming water, more than the mighty ocean breakers against the shore, LORD on high, you are powerful.

5Your decrees stand firm; holiness adorns your Temple forever.

item.title: Psalms 94
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 94

1LORD God of vengeance, shine!

2Rise up, Judge of the whole world; repay the proud.

3How long will you let sinners celebrate?

4How long will they pour out their arrogant words, vaunt themselves up

5crush your people, attack your heritage

6murder widows and foreigners and orphans,

7and say, “The LORD’s not watching; Jacob’s God is not paying attention.”

Ps 94:1-7

8You silly people, you pay attention; when will you ever understand?

item.title: Psalms 95
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 95

1Come, let’s sing to the LORD; let’s make a joyful sound to the Rock that saves us.

2Let’s go to him with thanksgiving and sing to him with psalms.

3The LORD is a great God, a great King above all gods.

4He controls the deep sea; he owns the mountain peaks

5and the ocean because he created them; he made the dry land.

Ps 95:1-5

6Come, let’s bow in worship; let’s kneel to the LORD our Maker.

item.title: Psalms 96
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 96

1Sing a new song to the LORD; sing to him, all the earth.

2Bless him in song; proclaim every day the good news that he saves.

3Tell about his glory the world over, his marvelous deeds among the nations.

4The LORD is great and deserves great praise; he’s to be respected more than all gods

5because the nations’ gods are idols, but the LORD created the sky.

item.title: Psalms 97
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 97

1The LORD reigns; let the world rejoice; let the distant shores be glad.

2Clouds and dense darkness surround him; goodness and justice are the foundation for his throne.

3Fire goes forth ahead of him and burns up his adversaries.

4His lightning lights up the world; the world sees it and trembles.

5The mountains melt like wax at his presence everywhere.

6The sky declares his goodness; every nation can see his glory.

item.title: Psalms 98
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 98

1Sing a new song to the LORD because he’s done outstanding things; his right hand and holy arm have given him victory.

2He has made his salvation known and revealed his goodness to the nations.

3He has remembered his enduring love and faithfulness to Israel; people the earth over have seen the deliverance our God gives.

Ps 98:1-3

4Make a joyful sound to the LORD, all the earth; break out in joyful song.

item.title: Psalms 99
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 99

1The LORD reigns; let the people tremble; he sits on his throne above the cherubs; let the earth quake!

2The LORD is great in Zion; he’s exalted above all nations.

3Let them praise his great, awesome name; he is holy.

4The great King who loves justice has established what’s fair for all.

5Exalt the LORD our God and worship at his feet; he is holy.

item.title: Psalms 100
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 100

1Make a joyful sound to the LORD, all the earth.

2Serve him gladly; come to him with singing.

3Acknowledge that the LORD is God; he made us; we didn’t make ourselves. We’re his people, sheep in his pasture.

4Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise. Thank him and bless him 5because he’s good; his enduring love never ends; his faithfulness extends to every generation.

item.title: Psalms 101
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 101

1I’ll sing about your enduring love and justice, and sing praises to you, LORD.

2I’ll pay attention to the way that’s blameless; when will you come to help me? In my home I’ll walk in integrity.

3I won’t set anything base beside me; I’ll hate what they do who fall away; I’ll stay away from them.

4I’ll cast perverse things out of my heart and have nothing to do with evil.

item.title: Psalms 102
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 102

1Listen to my prayer, LORD! Let my cry come to you.

2Don’t turn away from me in my distress; when I call, answer quickly.

3My days dissipate like smoke; my bones lie scorched on a hearth.

4My heart is weak and withers away like grass; I have no appetite 5in my loud groaning; I’m skin and bones.

6I’m like a pelican in the desert, like an owl in desolate places;

item.title: Psalms 103
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 103

1Bless the LORD, all that I am! Everything that’s in me, bless him.

2Bless the LORD, all that I am; May I never forget how he helps me:

3he pardons my sins and heals my diseases;

4he rescues me from the Pit and crowns me with enduring love and mercy;

5he satisfies my years with good things, and renews my youth like an eagle’s.

item.title: Psalms 104
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 104

1Bless the LORD, everything that I am! LORD my God, you’re so great; you’re dressed in splendor and majesty.

2You cover yourself with light as with a robe; you’ve stretched out the sky like a tent.

3You laid the beams for your rooms on the water; you make the clouds your chariot and walk on the wind.

4You make the winds your messengers and blazing fire your ministers.

item.title: Psalms 105
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 105

1Be grateful to the LORD; call on him; tell the nations what all he’s done.

2Sing praises to him; talk about the amazing acts.

3Take pride in his holy name; let the people be happy that rely on him.

4Rely on the LORD and his strength; depend on him always.

5Remember his amazing miracles, the judgments he’s rendered,

6descendants of Abraham his servant, children of Jacob, his chosen ones!

item.title: Psalms 106
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 106

1Hallelujah! Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good; his enduring love lasts forever.

2Who can recount all his mighty deeds? Who can ever praise him enough?

3How blessed they are who maintain justice, who practice goodness all the time!

4Remember me, LORD, when you’re gracious to your people; come and rescue me

5so I can share in your holy people’s prosperity, celebrate in your nation’s happiness, and glory in your heritage.

item.title: Psalms 107
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 107

1Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good; his love endures forever.

2Let his redeemed say it, the ones he rescued from their adversaries

3and gathered from other countries east and west, north and south.

Ps 107:1-3

4Some wandered in trackless desert and couldn’t find their way to any inhabited city.

5Hungry and thirsty, their souls fainted inside them.

6Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them from it;

item.title: Psalms 108
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 108

1I’m steadfast, God; I’ll sing praises in my heart.

2Wake up, harp and lyre; I’ll wake up at dawn!

3I’ll thank you, LORD, among the nations and sing praises to you everywhere,

4because your enduring love is bigger than the sky; your truth is as high as the heavens.

5Be lifted up, God, above the sky; display your glory the world over.

6Save with your power and answer me so your beloved can be delivered.

item.title: Psalms 109
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 109

1God that I praise, speak up for me!

2Deceitful people speak against me; they slander me with lies.

3They surround me with hateful words and fight me for no reason.

4In return for my love, they accuse me even when I’m praying for them.

5They repay me evil for good, hatred for love.

Ps 109:1-5

6Appoint someone corrupt over them, an accuser to stand beside them.

item.title: Psalms 110
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 110

1The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand till I make your enemies your footstool.”

2The LORD will extend your mighty scepter from on Zion, and say, “Rule your enemies.”

3Your soldiers will volunteer readily when you muster your army in holy array; your strength will be renewed every morning like the dew.

4The LORD has sworn and won’t change his mind, “You’re a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.”

item.title: Psalms 111
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 111

1Hallelujah! I thank the LORD with all my heart in the presence of his godly people.

2His works are so outstanding no one that delights in them can quit thinking about them;

3their splendor and majesty reflect his eternal goodness;

4he makes his amazing acts memorable because they show his grace and mercy.

5He feeds those who respect him and remembers his covenant with them;

6he demonstrated his power to his people by giving them other nations’ land.

item.title: Psalms 112
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 112

1Hallelujah! How blessed people are that respect the LORD and delight in what he calls on them to do.

2Their descendants will be successful and a blessing to their own generation.

3They’ll have wealth and riches in their homes, and their goodness will last forever.

4Godly people have light in the dark; they’re gracious, merciful, and good.

5Goodness comes to those who graciously lend and conduct their affairs with justice.

item.title: Psalms 113
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 113

1Hallelujah! Servants of the LORD, praise him;

2bless him from now on forever;

3from sunrise to sunset, praise him.

4On high above the nations, he displays his glory in the sky.

5Who is like the LORD our God that sits on high, 6but humbles himself to watch what’s happening in the sky and on earth?

7Then he raises up the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash pile

item.title: Psalms 114
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 114

1When Israel left Egypt— when the House of Jacob came out from a nation with a different language—

2the land of Judah became his sanctuary; Israel became his kingdom.

3The Red Sea saw them coming and backed away; the Jordan quit flowing.

4The mountains jumped like rams; the hills skipped around like lambs.

5What’s the matter with you, Sea, that you’re backing away, or Jordan, that you’ve quit flowing,

item.title: Psalms 115
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 115

1Not to us, LORD, not to us, but to you be honor because of your enduring love and faithfulness.

2Why should the nations say, “Where’s their God?”

3Our God is in heaven, where he accomplishes what he intends.

4Their man-made idols are just silver and gold

5with mouths that can’t talk, eyes that can’t see,

6ears that can’t hear, noses that can’t smell,

7hands that can’t feel, feet that can’t walk, throats that can’t make a sound!

item.title: Psalms 116
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 116

1I love the LORD because he listens to my petitions;

2so I’ll call on him as long as I live.

3The snares of death were all around me; the pains of Sheol came on me; I suffered distress and sorrow.

4Then I called on the LORD, “Please save me.”

Ps 116:1-4

5You’re gracious and good, merciful God.

6You preserve the simple; when I was brought low, you saved me.

item.title: Psalms 117
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 117

1Praise the LORD, every nation; praise him, every people group,

2because he has great enduring love toward us; hisY faithfulness lasts forever. Hallelujah!

Ps 117:1-2

item.title: Psalms 118
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 118

1Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good; his love lasts forever.

2Let Israel say, “His love lasts forever.”

3Let the house of Aaron say, “His love lasts forever.”

4Let those who respect the LORD say, “His love lasts forever.”

Ps 118:1-4

5I called on the LORD in my distress, and he answered me and set me free.

6He’s on my side; so I won’t be afraid; what can mortals do to me?

item.title: Psalms 119
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 119

1How blessed they are who follow his way blamelessly, who follow the Law of the LORD,

2who observe his testimonies and look to him with all their heart.

3They do no evil who follow his ways.

4You’ve charged us to keep your commandments diligently.

5Oh that my ways may become secure by reflecting on your statutes!

6I won’t be disgraced if I keep my eye on everything you’ve commanded.

item.title: Psalms 120
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 120

1In my troubles I appealed to the LORD, and he answered me.

2LORD, rescue me from lying lips and treacherous tongues.

3What will God do to you, treacherous tongues? How will he intensify your punishment?

4He’ll pierce you with a soldier’s sharp arrows and burn you with coals from a broom tree.

5Misfortune awaits me because I’m a foreigner in Meshech, because I live among the tents of Kedar!

item.title: Psalms 121
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 121

1I look up toward the mountains— will my help come from there?

2It’ll come from the LORD, who made earth and sky.

3He won’t let your foot slip. The One that guards you won’t slumber;

4he who watches over Israel never sleeps.

5The LORD is your keeper; he’s your protection nearby.

6The sun won’t harm you during the day or the moon at night.

7The LORD will protect you from harm and keep you alive.

item.title: Psalms 122
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 122

1It made me happy when they said, “Let’s go to the LORD’s Temple.”

2We’re standing inside your gates, Jerusalem,

3that’s built solid and seamless,

4where the tribes of the LORD go up as required by the Law to give him thanks;

5the thrones for judgment stand here, the thrones of David’s dynasty.

6Pray for peace in Jerusalem: “May they prosper who love you;

item.title: Psalms 123
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 123

1I look to you enthroned in heaven!

2Like a servant looks to his master and a maid looks to her mistress, we look to the LORD our God to show us mercy.

3Be gracious to us, LORD, because we’ve had our fill of contempt.

4For too long our lives have been full of the scorn of people at ease and the contempt of arrogant others.

Ps 123:1-4

item.title: Psalms 124
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 124

1Let Israel acknowledge, “If the LORD hadn’t taken our side

2when people attacked us,

3they would have swallowed us alive in their fury,

4the water would have overwhelmed us, the river would have rushed over us,

5the raging water would’ve drowned us.”

6Bless the LORD, who didn’t let us be torn to pieces in their teeth.

7We escaped like a bird from a trapper’s snare; the snare broke and we got away.

item.title: Psalms 125
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 125

1Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion, that can’t be moved, that lasts forever.

2Like mountains surround Jerusalem, the LORD surrounds his people from now on forever.

3Sinners won’t rule in the land allotted to good people because they’d tempt the good to do wrong.

4The LORD does good to those who do good, who are godly in heart.

5But those who turn aside to their crooked ways, he’ll lead away with sinners. Peace to Israel!

item.title: Psalms 126
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 126

1When the LORD brought us exiles back to Zion, we were like people dreaming.

2Our mouths were laughing, our tongues were shouting with joy; the other nations were saying of us, “The LORD has done great things for them.”

3Yes, the LORD has done great things for us; we’re happy.

4Restore our fortunes, LORD, like streams in the Negev.

5Those who sow in tears will reap with joy.

item.title: Psalms 127
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 127

1Unless the LORD builds the house, they work for nothing who build it; unless the LORD guards the city, its watchmen stay awake for no reason.

2In vain you rise early and work late to eat the food you gain by painful labor; he gives rest to the ones he loves.

3Children are a gift from the LORD; what the womb produces is a reward.

4Children born to a young man are like arrows in a soldier’s hand.

item.title: Psalms 128
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 128

1How blessed you are that respect the LORD and follow his ways.

2When you eat what you earn, you’ll be happy, and life will be good.

3Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in your house; your children will be like olive plants around your table.

4That’s how you’re blessed who respect the LORD.

5The LORD bless you from Zion; may you see Jerusalem prosper your whole life.

item.title: Psalms 129
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 129

1Let Israel say, 2“They’ve persecuted me often since I was young, but they haven’t defeated me.

3My back looks like a farmer plowed it and made long furrows.”

4The LORD is good; he has cut loose from me the cords of the wicked.

5May everyone that hates Zion be driven away and discredited.

6Let them be like grass on a rooftop that withers before it’s grown.

item.title: Psalms 130
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 130

1LORD, I’ve cried out to you from the depths;

2be attentive to my petitions.

3If you kept track of sins, who could stand?

4But you forgive so people can continue to respect you.

5I wait for the LORD and put my hope in what he says.

6I wait for the Lord more than watchmen hope for morning.

7Israel, put your hope in the LORD because there’s enduring love and abundant redemption in him.

item.title: Psalms 131
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 131

1LORD, my heart’s not proud or my eyes arrogant; I don’t insert myself into things I can’t handle.

2I’ve calmed and quieted myself; like a weaned child resting against its mother, my soul is quiet within me.

3Israel, put your hope in the LORD from now on forever.

Ps 131:1-3

item.title: Psalms 132
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 132

1LORD, remember David and what he suffered;

2how he swore to the LORD and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob: 3“I won’t go to my own house or get on my bed 4and sleep

5till I find a place for the LORD to live, a place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

Ps 132:1-5

6We heard it in Ephrathah and found it in the fields of Jaar, 7“Let’s go to his Temple and worship at his footstool.”

item.title: Psalms 133
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 133

1It’s so good and pleasant for brothers to live together in peace.

2It’s like precious anointing oil running down like it did on Aaron’s beard and dripped on his robe.

3It’s like the dew from Mount Hermon that falls on the hills around Mount Zion; the LORD commanded the blessing there—eternal life.

Ps 133:1-3

item.title: Psalms 134
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 134

1Bless the LORD, you servants of the LORD that serve him at night in his Temple!

2Raise your hands toward the sanctuary and bless him.

3May the One that made earth and sky bless you from Zion.

Ps 134:1-3

item.title: Psalms 135
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 135

1Hallelujah! Praise the LORD; praise him, his servant,

2you that stand in his Temple, in the courts of our God!

3Praise him because he’s good; sing his praises because he’s gracious,

4because he’s chosen Jacob for himself, Israel for his own possession.

Ps 135:1-4

5I know the LORD is great, that he’s above all gods.

6He does what he wants in the sky, on earth, in the seas and all their depths.

item.title: Psalms 136
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 136

1Give thanks to the LORD because he’s good. His love is everlasting.

2Give thanks to the God of gods. His love is everlasting.

3Give thanks to the Lord of lords, His love is everlasting.

4to him alone that does great things, His love is everlasting.

5to him that made the sky in his wisdom, His love is everlasting.

6to him that spread out the dry land higher than the water, His love is everlasting.

item.title: Psalms 137
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 137

1We sat by the rivers in Babylon and cried when we remembered Zion.

2We hung our harps on its willows.

3Our captors required us to sing there; our tormentors demanded happy songs, “Sing us a song from Zion.”

Ps 137:1-3

4How can we sing about the LORD in a foreign land?

5If I forget you, Jerusalem, may my right hand wither.

6May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you, if I don’t regard Jerusalem above my greatest joy.

item.title: Psalms 138
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 138

1I thank you with all my heart and sing your praises in front of the mighty.

2I bow toward your holy Temple and thank you for your enduring love and faithfulness, because you’ve guaranteed your promises with the honor your name has.

3You answered me when I called out to you and made me bold with strength.

Ps 138:1-3

4Kings will thank you, LORD, when they hear what you say.

item.title: Psalms 139
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 139

1LORD, you’ve known me and examined me.

2You know when I sit down and when I get up; from a long way off you know what I’m thinking.

3You search out my traveling and my resting; you’re well acquainted with my ways.

4Before I speak, you know what I’m going to say.

5You’ve protected me front and back and laid your hand over me.

6Knowledge like that is too amazing for me; it’s beyond me; I can’t imagine it.

item.title: Psalms 140
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 140

1LORD, rescue me from sinful people protect me from violent men,

2that plot evil things in their minds, and constantly stir up conflict.

3They have pointed tongues like a snake; viper’s venom lies behind their lips.

4LORD, protect me from sinful people; Protect me from violent men, that try to trip me.

5The arrogant hide traps for me; with cords they spread a net beside the road and set snares for me.

item.title: Psalms 141
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 141

1LORD, I’m calling on you; come quick; hear me out.

2Consider my prayer as incense and the raising of my hands as an evening offering.

3Guard my mouth; watch over my lips.

4Incline my heart away from anything evil, from practicing sinful things with sinners.

Ps 141:1-4

5Let a godly person strike me or rebuke me graciously; that would be ointment for my head; Don’t let me refuse it. I still pray constantly against the deeds of sinners.

item.title: Psalms 142
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 142

1I cry out to the LORD and petition him;

2I pour out my complaint to him and tell him my troubles.

3When I feel overwhelmed, he knows the route I should take; they’ve hidden traps for me on every path I walk.

4I look in every direction, but nobody notices me. There’s no escape for me; nobody cares if I live.

Ps 142:1-4

5I’m calling out to you, LORD; “You’re my refuge, my portion among the living.

item.title: Psalms 143
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 143

1Hear my prayer, LORD; listen to my petition; in your faithfulness and goodness, come to my relief.

2Don’t put me on trial because, compared to you, nobody’s good.

3My enemy has chased me, crushed me on the ground, and made me sit in the dark like people long dead.

4So I feel overwhelmed, and my heart is empty.

5I remember the old days; I ponder everything you’ve done and think about what you’ve made.

item.title: Psalms 144
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 144

1Bless the LORD, my Rock, who trains my hands for war, my fingers for battle.

2He’s my enduring love and fortress, my stronghold and deliverer, my shield and refuge, who subdues nations.

3LORD, what are we that you give us any thought or care about us?

4We’re like a breath; our lifetime is like a passing shadow.

Ps 144:1-4

5Lower the sky, LORD, and come down; touch the mountains and make them smoke.

item.title: Psalms 145
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 145

1I’ll praise you highly, my God and king, and bless you forever.

2I’ll bless you every day and praise you from now on.

3You’re great and deserve great praise; you have a greatness we have no way to measure.

4One generation will praise your works to the next and tell about the powerful things you’ve done.

5They’ll think about your majestic glory and splendor and about your amazing acts.

item.title: Psalms 146
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 146

1Praise the LORD, my soul!

2I’ll praise my God as long as I live and sing praises to him as long as I’m here.

3Don’t rely on rulers, mortals, who can’t help.

4They quit breathing and go back into the ground; their plans come to an end at the same time.

5How blessed they are that have Jacob’s God to help them, whose hope lies in the LORD

item.title: Psalms 147
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 147

1Hallelujah! It’s good to sing praises to our God; praising him is fitting because he’s gracious.

2The LORD builds up Jerusalem and gathers the outcasts in Israel.

3He heals the brokenhearted and bandages up their wounds.

4He counts the stars and calls them each by name.

5Our Lord is great and has great power, and understanding without limit.

6He supports the abused and takes sinners down to the ground.

item.title: Psalms 148
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 148

1Hallelujah! Praise the LORD from heaven; praise him in the sky.

2Praise him, all his hosts of angels.

3Praise him, sun and moon and shining stars.

4Praise him, highest heaven, and water vapor in the sky.

5Let them praise the LORD because he commanded and they came to be.

6He established them forever by a decree that won’t expire.

Ps 148:1-6

7Praise the LORD from earth, you sea monsters and all the great deep,

item.title: Psalms 149
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 149

1Hallelujah! Sing the LORD a new song; praise him in the assembly of his holy people.

2Be happy in your Maker, Israel; celebrate your King, people of Zion.

3Praise him with dancing; sing praises with tambourines and lyres,

4because the LORD delights in you and graces harassed people with deliverance.

Ps 149:1-4

5Holy people, celebrate in glory; sing for joy on your couches.

6Have the high praises of God in your voices and two-edged swords in your hands

item.title: Psalms 150
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 150

1Hallelujah! Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his heavenly expanse.

2Praise him for his powerful deeds in proportion to his greatness.

3Praise him with trumpet, harp, and lyre.

4Praise him with tambourines and dancing, with stringed instruments and flutes.

5Praise him with cymbals, with loud crashing cymbals.

6Everything that breathes, praise the LORD. Hallelujah!

Ps 150:1-6

Version by Virgil Warren: christir.org
